snippet: Some Ebola patients still die at a Sierra Leone hospital, but just as many, if not more, are dying in the city and neighboring villages, increasing the risk of the disease’s spread.
abstract: High rate of Ebola-related deaths at government hospital in Kenema, Sierra Leone, has forced patients and health workers to flee hospital but has not stemmed tide of death, which continues in city and neighboring villages; presence of disease throughout community has increased risk of disease's spread and undermined international efforts to halt epidemic.

byline.contributor: Tommy Trenchard contributed reporting from Kenema; Clair MacDougall from Monrovia, Liberia; and Sabrina Tavernise from Washington.

lead_paragraph: Some Ebola patients still die at a Sierra Leone hospital, but just as many, if not more, are dying in the city and neighboring villages, increasing the risk of the disease’s spread.

headline.main: ‘Don’t Touch the Walls’: Ebola Fears Infect an African Hospital
headline.print_headline: ‘Don’t Touch the Walls’: Ebola Fears Infect an African Hospital
